gdtm.helpers.common

gdtm.helpers.common.day(d)

Epoch function. Takes a date and normalizes it to the day (removing hour, minute, second). Every datetime object from January 1, 2021 (e.g. January 1, 2021 03:12:48, January 1, 2021 12:45:00) will return January 1, 2021.

Parameters

d – Datetime object

Returns

Datetime object

gdtm.helpers.common.fortnight(d)

Epoch function. Takes a date and normalizes it to the first day of its fortnight (two-week period). Every date from January 4-17, 2021 will return January 4, 2021. Note: Unsure if this is a valid date range for a fortnight, or if we are off by a week.

Parameters

d – Datetime object

Returns

Datetime object

gdtm.helpers.common.get_time_periods(dataset, epoch_function)

Computes all valid time periods in a data set, given the dates and an epoch function.

Parameters

  • dataset – list of lists

  • epoch_function – a function that normalizes dates to a time period

Returns

sorted list of time periods

gdtm.helpers.common.get_vocabulary(docs)

Given a set of documents, computes the unique vocabulary. This version of get_vocabulary takes 0.08 seconds on 100,000 documents whereas the old version took forever.

Parameters

docs – list of lists

Returns

list of unique words

gdtm.helpers.common.load_dated_dataset(path, date_delimiter='\t', doc_delimiter=' ')
Load a data set with dates from a CSV.

The file format should be one line per document, with the date field, followed by the document. The date and document delimiters should be different. For example: 09/10/2021[tab]word1,word2,word3…wordn

Parameters

  • path – path (including file name) of data set file

  • date_delimiter – character, optional: character delimiting date from docuemnt on a line

  • doc_delimiter – character, optional: character delimiting words in a document

Returns

list of tuples (date, document [list of words])

gdtm.helpers.common.load_flat_dataset(path, delimiter=' ')
Load a data set from a CSV.

Each document should be its own line, with each word in a document separated by the delimiter character.

Parameters

  • path – path (including file name) of data set file

  • delimiter – character, optional: character delimiting words in a document

Returns

list of lists

gdtm.helpers.common.load_noise_dist(path, delimiter=',')

Load a noise distribution from a CSV.

Parameters

  • path – path (including file name) to save topic set to.

  • delimiter – character, optional: character delimiting words in a document

Returns

list of tuples (word, frequency)

gdtm.helpers.common.load_split_dataset(path, file_name, num_time_periods, delimiter=' ')

Load a data set sliced into tranches for temporal modeling.

Parameters

  • path – path (including file name) of data set file

  • file_name – the name of the data set

  • num_time_periods – the number of time periods that the data set has been sliced into (tranches)

  • delimiter – character, optional: character delimiting words in a document

Returns

list of lists of lists (list of time periods, containing list of documents, containing list of words)

gdtm.helpers.common.load_topics(path, delimiter=',')

Load topic set from a CSV.

Parameters

  • path – path (including file name) to save topic set to.

  • delimiter – character, optional: character delimiting words in a document

Returns

list of lists

gdtm.helpers.common.month(d)

Epoch function. Takes a date and normalizes it to the nearest year and month. Every date from January 2021 will return January 1, 2021.

Parameters

d – Datetime object

Returns

Datetime object

gdtm.helpers.common.none(d)

Epoch function. The null date normalizer. Normalizes every date to 1.

Parameters

d – Datetime object

Returns

1

gdtm.helpers.common.save_flat_dataset(path, dataset, delimiter=' ')
Save a data set to a CSV.

Each data set is saved to its own line in the CSV, with each word separated by the delimiter character.

Parameters

  • path – path (including file name) of data set file

  • dataset – list of lists

  • delimiter – character, optional: character delimiting words in a document

Returns

gdtm.helpers.common.save_noise_dist(noise, path)

Save the words in a noise distribution to a CSV.

Parameters

  • noise – list of tuples (word, frequency)

  • path – path (including file name) to save noise distribution to.

Returns

gdtm.helpers.common.save_split_dataset(path, file_name, dataset, delimiter=' ')

Save a data set sliced into tranches for temporal modeling.

Parameters

  • path – path (including file name) of data set file

  • file_name – the name of the data set

  • dataset – list of lists of lists (list of time periods, containing list of documents, containing list of words)

  • delimiter – character, optional: character delimiting words in a document

Returns

None

gdtm.helpers.common.save_topics(topics, path, delimiter=',')

Saves a topic set to a CSV.

Parameters

  • topics – list of lists

  • path – path (including file name) to save topic set to.

  • delimiter – character, optional: character delimiting words in a document

Returns

gdtm.helpers.common.split_dataset_by_date(dataset, epoch_function)

Takes a data set and epoch function, and splits the data set into tranches based on the valid time periods.

Parameters

  • dataset – list of lists

  • epoch_function – a function that normalizes dates to a time period

Returns

list of lists of lists (data set split into time periods)

gdtm.helpers.common.week(d)

Epoch function. Takes a date and normalizes it to the first day of its week. Every date from January 4-10, 2021 will return January 4, 2021.

Parameters

d – Datetime object

Returns

Datetime object

gdtm.helpers.common.year(d)

Epoch function. Takes a date and normalizes it to the nearest year. Every date from 2021 will return January 1, 2021.

Parameters

d – Datetime object

Returns

Datetime object
